conbody.p: This section illustrates a proof-of-concept installation on CentOS 6.3 running the KVM hypervisor. You will install from packages.For installation guides on other Linux distributions and versions, refer to the Installation Guide at http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs.

A basic proof-of-concept installation requires two physical hosts, one for the front-end components (Cloud Controller, Walrus, Cluster Controller, and Storage Controller) and another as a Node Controller.
Ensure that time is synchronized between the Eucalyptus hosts. You will also want to ensure that SELiux is disabled and that the Eucalyptus ports are not blocked by any firewall.
